availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert B. Holland (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. LaRue County, Kentucky, native. Son of William M. Holland and Martha A. Scott Holland. Farmer in LaRue County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 31, 1861, to April 23, 1863. Wounded at the Battle of Shiloh, Hardin County, Tennessee, on April 7, 1862. Discharged on April 23, 1863, on account of disability.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, LaRue County, Hamiltons District, p. 402A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 633.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 20666.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0265.
